MS.S: To be used later to determine how long the TS ran
Set Power Scheme to High Performance
OSDVer contains the version of the task sequence (i.e. 1.0, 2.5, 5.0, etc.) and is used by the script to keep the results from different versions of the sequence separated.

OSDBranch is a variable I use to identify what stage the sequence is currently (i.e. DEV/QA/PILOT/PROD). The script will use this to keep results from Development builds from skewing results from Production builds.

The PowerShell script that does the work of collecting the data and writing it out to the CSV file is relatively simple. It pulls in the required variables, calculates the elapsed runtime in minutes and used WMI to query the computer model. This is all the

Scan mit DCU, ob BIOS und/oder Treiber Updates vorhanden sind. Installation, wenn vorhanden.
Actions to capture files and settings in the original operating system
To be used later to determine how long the TS ran
---I--If none of these conditions are true:--/I----CRLF----TAB----B--File Exists:--/B----CRLF----TAB----TAB--C:\Program Files\Dell\CommandUpdate\dcu-cli.exe
smsswd.exe /run: powershell.exe -command "&{$tsenv = New-Object -COMObject Microsoft.SMS.TSEnvironment; $tsenv.Value('SMSTS_UpdateTime') = Get-Date -Format yyyyMMddTHHmmss}"
Used to make the Logs unique if process runs more than once
smsswd.exe /run: cmd.exe /c if Not Exist "C:\Temp\DCU" (md C:\Temp\DCU)
This folder & Subfolder are used to Store the setting template xml files, along with the reports genearated by DCU
smsswd.exe /run: cmd.exe /c if Not Exist "C:\Temp\DCULogs" (md C:\Temp\DCULogs)
This Folder Collects the XML Log Files and time stamps them for historical viewing
smsswd.exe /run: powershell.exe -command "&{$tsenv = New-Object -COMObject Microsoft.SMS.TSEnvironment; $tsenv.Value('SMSTS_BIOSStartTime') = Get-Date -Format 'dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss'}"
Creates Variable with Time, which will be used later to figure out the time taken for proces to run
Run DCU if BIOS Update exists
Grabs Current BIOS Value to be recorded later
Run Dell Command Update Install BIOS Updates
Grabs BIOS Version installed, for reporting later
smsswd.exe /run: powershell.exe -command "&{$tsenv = New-Object -COMObject Microsoft.SMS.TSEnvironment; $tsenv.Value('SMSTS_BIOSFinishTime') = Get-Date -Format 'dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss'}"
Creates Variable with Time, which will be used later to figure out the time taken for proces to run
smsswd.exe /run: powershell.exe -command "&{$tsenv = New-Object -COMObject Microsoft.SMS.TSEnvironment; $tsenv.Value('SMSTS_DriversStartTime') = Get-Date -Format 'dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss'}"

Records BIOS Before & After Versions, and Time taken to update BIOS and Time to update Drivers. This is setup to work as Stand Alone Deployment, or inside (child TS) OSD / IPU, if you're using the WaaS Process I blogged about on GARYTOWN.COM

Fixs a bunch of little issues and makes things run smoother
Set Power Scheme to High Performance
Runs the task sequence with maximum performance to improve responsiveness and decreasing total imaging time
This prevents command line from being launched, so we clear it to enable troubleshooting
---I--If all of these conditions are true:--/I----CRLF----TAB----B--File Exists:--/B----CRLF----TAB----TAB--c:\Windows\Setup\scripts\DisableCMDRequest.TAG
Set CCM Service to Auto Start
CCM defaults to Auto-Delayed, but CCMEval will set it to Auto. We bump it to Auto which speeds up the service (and TS) starting up after a reboot.
Changes WMI to be in a higher level group so it starts sooner
Changes group policy to be a stand alone service. This handles an issue where the very first logon fails.

Sets the default policies so that PowerShell scripts can run while Windows is being deployed. Fixes issues with PowerShell scripts running and Application deployments that use PowerShell detection methods.
Diese Script setzt WoL Einstellungen im BIOS und in Windows sowie der LAN-NIC
Sets WMI to run off a static port
smsswd.exe /run: cmd /c netsh firewall add portopening TCP 24158 WMIFixedPort
Adds a rule to the firewall to allow WMI connections
Sets a default code if no error code was returned
---I--If any of these conditions are true:--/I----CRLF----TAB----B--Task Sequence Variable:--/B----CRLF----TAB----TAB--ErrorReturnCode notExists
Set the timeout to be 24 hours
